name: PHIL 290P
title: Major Figures in Contemporary Philosophy
description: Focuses on philosophical writings and significance of a single figure in contemporary (20th- and 21st-century) philosophy. May include, but not be limited to, Russell, Whitehead, Wittgenstein, Husserl, Carnap, Murdoch, Quine, Irigaray, Derrida, and Davidson. May be repeated for credit.

pre_req_data.text: Enrollment is restricted to philosophy graduate students.
